description: Governance baseline contract - declares expected normality ranges for observed signals

observationWindow.notes: Rolling window for baseline evaluation. Minimum signals required for statistical significance.

human_override.notes: Human overrides should be rare events (0-3 per window). Each override represents intentional bypass of governance controls.
human_override.context: Higher counts may indicate either legitimate critical decisions or governance friction requiring attention.

ethical_veto.notes: Ethical vetos indicate the ethical layer is functioning. Expected range of 0-5 per observation window.
ethical_veto.context: Zero vetos may indicate the ethical layer is not triggered. Consistently high vetos suggest system design issues.

tier_violation.notes: Tier boundary violations should be minimal (0-2 per window). Violations indicate code structure misalignment with governance tiers.
tier_violation.context: Zero violations in early deployment is unrealistic. Consistent violations require tier classification review.

ambiguity_failure.notes: Ambiguity failures arise from mixed-tier code or unclassified files. Expected 0-4 per window.
ambiguity_failure.context: High ambiguity indicates architectural boundaries are not clear. This is a design signal, not a code defect.

repeated_pattern.notes: Repeated patterns (â‰¥3 occurrences) suggest systemic issues. Expected 0-1 unique pattern per window.
repeated_pattern.context: Multiple repeated patterns indicate structural problems that should be addressed at the root cause level.

totalSignalsPerWindow.notes: Total governance signals should remain within healthy operational bounds. Very low counts may indicate governance is not engaged; very high counts may indicate system friction.

enforcementSignals.notes: Tier violations + ethical vetos should be 10-40% of all signals. Higher ratios suggest governance is blocking too frequently.

overrideSignals.notes: Human overrides should be 0-20% of all signals. Higher ratios indicate excessive bypass activity.

context.notes: This baseline is calibrated for early-stage deployment where governance patterns are still emerging. Expect higher signal variance. Adjust ranges after 90 days of operational data.

interpretationGuidelines.withinRange: Signals are within expected normality. No action required unless persistent trends emerge.
interpretationGuidelines.belowRange: Signals below minimum may indicate governance is not being triggered (design review recommended).
interpretationGuidelines.aboveRange: Signals above maximum indicate deviation from expected normality. Review context before action. Not all deviations are problems.
interpretationGuidelines.trendingUp: Consistent increase across multiple windows may require governance design review.
interpretationGuidelines.trendingDown: Consistent decrease may indicate governance improvements or reduced engagement (verify).

humanIntent.purpose: This contract provides a reference frame for interpreting governance signals. It does not block or enforce anything. Humans use this baseline to contextualize observed governance behavior and make informed decisions.
humanIntent.usage: Compare governance-signals.json summary against these baselines. Deviations prompt review, not automatic action.

history.changeLog: Initial baseline established. Conservative ranges set for early deployment stage.
